6491a9d90763e.Name: Garden Waste Enquiry - search permit
6491a9d90763e.Output_template:
{"method":"GET","url":"{tokenPermiServAPI}&dataType=get&callType=search&returnType=jsonxmlsafe&uprn={uprn}&expiryDate={dateExpiry}","enableURLHashing":"no","show_headers":"no","responseType":"JSON","strip_namespaces":"1","path_to_values":"permit","fields":"{
	"permitId":"permitId"
	"permitType":"permitType"
	"dateDispatched":"dateDispatched"
	"state":"state"
	"cancelled":"cancelled"
	"activePermit":"activePermit"
	"pendingDelivery":"pendingDelivery"
}","xslt_stylesheet":"<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>
<xsl:stylesheet version="1.0" xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform">
	<xsl:template match="/">
		<results>
			<xsl:for-each select="Root/Result/ArrayNode">
				<xsl:sort select="dateDispatched" order="descending" />
				<xsl:element name="permit">
					<xsl:element name="permitId">
						<xsl:value-of select='permitId' />
					</xsl:element>
					<xsl:element name="dateDispatched">
						<xsl:value-of select='dateDispatched' />
					</xsl:element>
					<xsl:element name="cancelled">
						<xsl:value-of select='cancelled' />
					</xsl:element>
					<xsl:element name="state">
						<xsl:value-of select='state' />
					</xsl:element>
					<xsl:element name="permitType">
						<xsl:value-of select='permitType' />
					</xsl:element>
					<xsl:element name="permitCount">
						<xsl:value-of select='1' />
					</xsl:element>
					<xsl:choose>
						<xsl:when test="cancelled = 1">
							<xsl:element name="pendingDelivery">
								<xsl:value-of select='0' />
							</xsl:element>
						</xsl:when>
						<xsl:when test="state = 'Replaced'">
							<xsl:element name="pendingDelivery">
								<xsl:value-of select='0' />
							</xsl:element>
						</xsl:when>
						<xsl:when test="dateDispatched = ''">
							<xsl:element name="pendingDelivery">
								<xsl:value-of select='1' />
							</xsl:element>
						</xsl:when>
						<xsl:otherwise>
							<xsl:element name="pendingDelivery">
								<xsl:value-of select='0' />
							</xsl:element>
						</xsl:otherwise>
					</xsl:choose>
					<xsl:choose>
						<xsl:when test="cancelled = 1">
							<xsl:element name="activePermit">
								<xsl:value-of select='0' />
							</xsl:element>
						</xsl:when>
						<xsl:when test="state = 'Replaced'">
							<xsl:element name="activePermit">
								<xsl:value-of select='0' />
							</xsl:element>
						</xsl:when>
						<xsl:when test="cancelled = 0">
							<xsl:element name="activePermit">
								<xsl:value-of select='1' />
							</xsl:element>
						</xsl:when>
					</xsl:choose>
				</xsl:element>
			</xsl:for-each>
			
			<xsl:for-each select="Root/Result">
				<xsl:element name="permit">
					<xsl:element name="permitId">
						<xsl:value-of select='permitId' />
					</xsl:element>
					<xsl:element name="dateDispatched">
						<xsl:value-of select='dateDispatched' />
					</xsl:element>
					<xsl:element name="cancelled">
						<xsl:value-of select='cancelled' />
					</xsl:element>
					<xsl:element name="state">
						<xsl:value-of select='state' />
					</xsl:element>
					<xsl:element name="permitType">
						<xsl:value-of select='permitType' />
					</xsl:element>
					<xsl:if test="permitId > 0">
						<xsl:element name="permitCount">
							<xsl:value-of select='1' />
						</xsl:element>
					</xsl:if>
					<xsl:choose>
						<xsl:when test="dateDispatched = ''">
							<xsl:element name="pendingDelivery">
								<xsl:value-of select='1' />
							</xsl:element>
						</xsl:when>
						<xsl:otherwise>
							<xsl:element name="pendingDelivery">
								<xsl:value-of select='0' />
							</xsl:element>
						</xsl:otherwise>
					</xsl:choose>
					<xsl:choose>
						<xsl:when test="cancelled = 1">
							<xsl:element name="activePermit">
								<xsl:value-of select='0' />
							</xsl:element>
						</xsl:when>
						<xsl:when test="state = 'Replaced'">
							<xsl:element name="activePermit">
								<xsl:value-of select='0' />
							</xsl:element>
						</xsl:when>
						<xsl:when test="cancelled = 0">
							<xsl:element name="activePermit">
								<xsl:value-of select='1' />
							</xsl:element>
						</xsl:when>
					</xsl:choose>
				</xsl:element>
			</xsl:for-each>
		</results>
	</xsl:template>
</xsl:stylesheet>","results_page_columns":"","secure_fields_db_http":""}

props.validationMessage: Please update your profile before completing this form.

props.label: html 9
props.content:
Before You Begin

You can use this form to report a problem with an existing garden waste permit. You can report on the following categories:

  • My garden waste permit is damaged or lost and I need a replacement.
  • I ordered a garden waste permit and it has not arrived.

props.label: html 10
props.content: Please note: Garden Waste permits for the year up to {dateExpiry} are now available to purchase thorugh our permit ordering form. We are unable to replace permits for the previous year at this time. If you permit has been lost or damaged, please order a new permit for the upcoming year.

props.label: html 1
props.content: We have not been able to recognise your address from the details on your profile. Please update your profile before completing this form and use the search function to find your address. To update your profile please click on your name at the top right of the screen and then ‘My Profile’.

props.label: html 2
props.content:
How our garden waste services work

Permits are issued on an annual basis covering 1st September to 31st August, and you must apply each year for each permit you require. You can apply for a new permit using our Apply for garden waste collection form.

Individual Properties

If you reside in a property that has individual wheeled bins (for example a detached or semi-detached house) then the brown bin can be used for food waste free of charge. This bin is also used for garden waste but you must hold a permit in order to use garden waste collection service. If you use the brown bin for garden waste and food waste without a valid permit, the bin will not be collected and emptied until the garden waste is removed. You can apply for multiple garden waste bins and permits up to a maximum of three brown bins.

If you share a brown wheeled bin amongst two or more properties and you require garden waste collection then you must nominate a resident to arrange for the order and payment of the permit.

Flatted or Multiple Dwellings

If you reside in a property that utilises a communal food waste bin then there is one bin for all residents to use for food waste. Garden waste should not be added to this bin. Those properties are typically multiple dwellings of 6 or more flats in a block, with multiple blocks. If these dwellings are owned or managed by Aberdeen City Council, then we will manage the garden waste on the residents behalf as we tend to the grounds. If the dwellings are privately owned, then we expect the Factor to manage garden waste.

Additional questions and support

As a reminder, if your property qualifies for garden waste collection and you wish to purchase a permit, the following applies:

  • An annual charge of £30 for a garden waste permit. This covers 2 brown bins, but you must order a second brown bin via our dedicated form if you require. There is a charge of £36.10 for an additional bin including the delivery.
  • If you require a third food/garden waste bin, you must order another permit and another waste bin.

Please refer to our Buy a garden waste permit support page for additional frequently asked questions and support.

Aberdeen City Council has a number of Waste Service related forms, some of which allow you to report issues with all types of waste bins including garden waste. Some of these include:

  • Bin Collection Assistance
  • Bin Collection Calendar
  • Bin Collection Missed - report
  • Bin Replacement or Additional - request
  • Bulky Waste Uplift - request
  • Bulky Waste Uplift - cancel request
  • Communal Bin repairs - request
  • Fly-tipping - report
  • Garden Waste Collection - apply

It is important that you use the correct form to request the service you need. You will find all these forms and more on our list of Online Services.

Cannot locate your address on our system?

Occasionally, due to new homes being developed or other address challenges, you may not be able to locate your address on our customer portal. If you encounter this problem please contact our Contact Centre on 03000 200 292 Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm.

What happens next

Once we receive your request we shall pass it straight to our supplier for printing of the replacement permit. Occasionally we have to review the requests before we issue a replacement permit, so please monitor your email account for any update or request of additional information from us.

Estimated time to complete: 5 minutes

props.label: html 4
props.content:
Request

You currently have {textActivePermitCount} Garden Waste permits.

Please select the appropriate permit below and tell us how we can help you.

Garden Waste permits are valid from 1st September to 31st August annually. If the permit you wish to report is close to expiry you may prefer to wait until the permit expires then place an order for a new permit. However, please be aware that if the permit is significantly damaged or removed we may not be able to collect your garden waste as our Crews may not be able to verify that you have a valid permit.

props.label: What would you like to request?

props.content:
No Record of Permits

We currently have no record of permits issued to this address with the expiry date {dateExpiry}. If the customer believes this is incorrect or has had some issue with ordering their permit, provide details below.

Please provide as much information as possible so that the waste team can investigate, for example:

  • Reference number for ordered permits
  • Date and reference of any payments
  • Any other useful information

Declaration

Please note that a valid permit must be attached to a bin in order to be emptied of garden waste. No brown bin will be emptied of garden waste without a permit.

Please confirm that the details you have provided are correct and that you accept the Terms and Conditions.
